clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy, Usability Study of the GlucoTab System for Glycaemic Management in Type 2 Diabetic Patients at General Wards
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Single-centre, Non-controlled Study of Efficacy, Safety and Usability of the GlucoTab System for Glycaemic Management in Non-critically Ill Patients With Type 2 Diabetes at General Wards

brief_summary.textblock: Objective: To investigate the performance (safety) of the GlucoTab system for glycaemic management in non-critically ill patients with type 2 diabetes at general wards.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean percentage of blood glucose measurements in the target range 70 to 140 mg/dl, as calculated by all premeal and bedtime glucose values measured ≥ 24 hours after start of therapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: duration of hospital stay (maximum three weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of blood glucose measurements per day
secondary_outcome.time_frame: duration of hospital stay (maximum three weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Adherence to the insulin dose suggestion of the GlucoTab system
secondary_outcome.time_frame: duration of hospital stay (maximum three weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean daily blood glucose as calculated by premeal and bedtime blood glucose values: Overall and per treatment day
secondary_outcome.time_frame: duration of hospital stay (maximum three weeks)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed consent obtained after being advised of the nature of the study
- Male or female aged ≥18 years
- Type 2 diabetes (treated with diet, oral agents, non-insulin injected anti-diabetic medicine, insulin therapy or any combination of the four) or newly diagnosed hyperglycaemia which requires s.c. insulin therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 diabetes, gestational diabetes
- Any disease or condition which the investigator or treating physician feels would interfere with the trial or the safety of the patient
- Pregnancy
- Any mental condition rendering the patient incapable of giving his consent
- Known or suspected allergy to insulin glargine or insulin aspart
- Continuous parenteral nutrition
- Participation in another trial which can influence the software algorithm
